articles.title: Quang Nguyen
articles.contents:
Biography



I finished my Master of Science degree in Applied Statistics at Loyola University Chicago in December 2021. I previously graduated from Wittenberg University in Springfield, Ohio with a BS in Mathematics and Data Science in May 2020. I am originally from Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa, which is located in the South Central Coast of Vietnam (hence this is what the username qntkhvn represents). In my free time, you may find me watching sports, listening to podcasts, and cooking. I am a huge supporter of Manchester United F.C. of the English Premier League as well as NBA’s LA Clippers.
Education
   MS in Applied Statistics, December 2021
        Loyola University Chicago
   BS in Mathematics and Data Science, May 2020
        Wittenberg University
Interests
Statistics in sports
Data visualization
Using R and RStudio for data science
Statistics education
Contact
   nminhquang.99@gmail.com
   @qntkhvn
My old website: qntkhvn.github.io/quang

            Quang Nguyen
          
          
            
              Welcome to my personal website! I am a first year
              student in the Department of Statistics & Data Science
              at Carnegie Mellon University, starting in August 2022. I
              previously completed my MS in Applied Statistics at Loyola
              University Chicago and BS in Mathematics and Data Science
              at Wittenberg University. My interests include statistics
              in sports, data science, and computing.

articles.title: News
articles.contents:
Upcoming
09/2022: Invited talk at the 2022 Cascadia Symposium on
Statistics in Sports (CASSIS).
08/2022: Starting my PhD in the Department of Statistics and Data
Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
Recent
05/2022: I was a guest on Episode
IX of the Open Source Sports Podcast.
03/2022: My paper An Examination of
Olympic Sport Climbing Competition Format and Scoring System
was accepted for publication in
the Journal of Data Science.
Spring 2022: I spent a semester at Loyola University Chicago as an
instructor in the Department of
Mathematics and Statistics.
12/2021: I completed my MS in Applied
Statistics at Loyola University Chicago.
11/2021: I won the Reproducible Research
Competition (Open Methods Track) at the 2021 Carnegie Mellon
Sports Analytics Conferece (CMSAC) with my paper An
Examination of Sport Climbing’s Competition Format and Scoring
System
10/2021: I won the Best Student Poster Award at
the 2021 UConn Sports
Analytics Conferece (UCSAS) with my poster Concerns
Regarding Sport Climbing Competition Format and Scoring System: Who’s
Suffering?
10/2021: I took part in the 2021 Humana-Mays
Healthcare Analytics Case Competition (organized by Texas A&M
University). Our team finished 2/50 in the First
Round Leaderboard, where the goal was to build a model for
predicting vaccine hesitancy.
09/2021: I participated in a live coding session
where I tried to predict the 2021 Brownlow Medal Winner for the
Australian Football League (AFL). This was Rob Nguyen’s idea, where
he wanted to pair up a stats person with no knowledge of Aussie rules
with a journalist with domain expertise to see how well they can do at
making predictions. Here are links to a video recording
and an article
on ABC News (Australia).
